alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; Gadsden; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Inland Wakulla; Jackson; Leon; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 12:28PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Jackson, Gulf, southeastern Bay and eastern Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, western Wakulla, Gadsden, Liberty, central Leon and Franklin Counties in Big Bend of Florida through 100 PM EDT/NOON CDT/... At 1227 PM EDT/1127 AM CDT/, residual wind gusts of 40 mph or greater were occurring behind an earlier line of thunderstorms. The area of wind was centered along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Chattahoochee to 10 miles southeast of Blountstown to near Port St. Joe. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tallahassee, Apalachicola, Quincy, Havana, Blountstown, Midway, Port St. Joe, Mexico Beach, Stonemill Creek, Chattahoochee, Greensboro, Tyndall Air Force Base, Orange, Wewahitchka, Sneads, Gretna, Bristol, Rock Bluff, Honeyville and Jewel Fire Tower. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT/200 PM CDT/ for Big Bend of and the Panhandle of Florida.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Coastal Bay; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Gulf; Gadsden; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Inland Wakulla; Jackson; Leon; Liberty
